summary: Merge alignment data from a SAM or BAM with data in an unmapped BAM file.

arguments.summary: Adds the mate CIGAR tag (MC) if true, does not if false.
arguments.name: --ADD_MATE_CIGAR

arguments.summary: Add PG tag to each read in a SAM or BAM
arguments.name: --ADD_PG_TAG_TO_READS

arguments.summary: SAM or BAM file(s) with alignment data.
arguments.name: --ALIGNED_BAM

arguments.summary: Whether to output only aligned reads.
arguments.name: --ALIGNED_READS_ONLY

arguments.summary: Use the aligner's idea of what a proper pair is rather than computing in this program.
arguments.name: --ALIGNER_PROPER_PAIR_FLAGS

arguments.summary: Attributes from the alignment record that should be removed when merging.  This overrides ATTRIBUTES_TO_RETAIN if they share common tags.
arguments.name: --ATTRIBUTES_TO_REMOVE

arguments.summary: Reserved alignment attributes (tags starting with X, Y, or Z) that should be brought over from the alignment data when merging.
arguments.name: --ATTRIBUTES_TO_RETAIN

arguments.summary: Attributes on negative strand reads that need to be reversed.
arguments.name: --ATTRIBUTES_TO_REVERSE

arguments.summary: Attributes on negative strand reads that need to be reverse complemented.
arguments.name: --ATTRIBUTES_TO_REVERSE_COMPLEMENT

arguments.summary: Whether to clip adapters where identified.
arguments.name: --CLIP_ADAPTERS

arguments.summary: For paired reads, soft clip the 3' end of each read if necessary so that it does not extend past the 5' end of its mate.
arguments.name: --CLIP_OVERLAPPING_READS

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and GELI).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: The expected orientation of proper read pairs. Replaces JUMP_SIZE
arguments.name: --EXPECTED_ORIENTATIONS

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: If false, do not write secondary alignments to output.
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_SECONDARY_ALIGNMENTS

arguments.summary: Whether the lane is bisulfite sequence (used when calculating the NM tag).
arguments.name: --IS_BISULFITE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: The expected jump size (required if this is a jumping library). Deprecated. Use EXPECTED_ORIENTATIONS instead
arguments.name: --JUMP_SIZE

arguments.summary: List of Sequence Records tags that must be equal (if present) in the reference dictionary and in the aligned file. Mismatching tags will cause an error if in this list, and a warning otherwise.
arguments.name: --MATCHING_DICTIONARY_TAGS

arguments.summary: The maximum number of insertions or deletions permitted for an alignment to be included. Alignments with more than this many insertions or deletions will be ignored. Set to -1 to allow any number of insertions or deletions.
arguments.name: --MAX_INSERTIONS_OR_DELETIONS

arguments.summary: When writing SAM files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort a SAM file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: If UNMAP_CONTAMINANT_READS is set, require this many unclipped bases or else the read will be marked as contaminant.
arguments.name: --MIN_UNCLIPPED_BASES

arguments.summary: Merged SAM or BAM file to write to.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: This argument is ignored and will be removed.
arguments.name: --PAIRED_RUN

arguments.summary: Strategy for selecting primary alignment when the aligner has provided more than one alignment for a pair or fragment, and none are marked as primary, more than one is marked as primary, or the primary alignment is filtered out for some reason. BestMapq expects that multiple alignments will be correlated with HI tag, and prefers the pair of alignments with the largest MAPQ, in the absence of a primary selected by the aligner. EarliestFragment prefers the alignment which maps the earliest base in the read. Note that EarliestFragment may not be used for paired reads. BestEndMapq is appropriate for cases in which the aligner is not pair-aware, and does not output the HI tag. It simply picks the alignment for each end with the highest MAPQ, and makes those alignments primary, regardless of whether the two alignments make sense together.MostDistant is also for a non-pair-aware aligner, and picks the alignment pair with the largest insert size. If all alignments would be chimeric, it picks the alignments for each end with the best MAPQ.  For all algorithms, ties are resolved arbitrarily.
arguments.name: --PRIMARY_ALIGNMENT_STRATEGY

arguments.summary: The command line of the program group (if not supplied by the aligned file).
arguments.name: --PROGRAM_GROUP_COMMAND_LINE

arguments.summary: The name of the program group (if not supplied by the aligned file).
arguments.name: --PROGRAM_GROUP_NAME

arguments.summary: The version of the program group (if not supplied by the aligned file).
arguments.name: --PROGRAM_GROUP_VERSION

arguments.summary: The program group ID of the aligner (if not supplied by the aligned file).
arguments.name: --PROGRAM_RECORD_ID

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: SAM or BAM file(s) with alignment data from the first read of a pair.
arguments.name: --READ1_ALIGNED_BAM

arguments.summary: The number of bases trimmed from the beginning of read 1 prior to alignment
arguments.name: --READ1_TRIM

arguments.summary: SAM or BAM file(s) with alignment data from the second read of a pair.
arguments.name: --READ2_ALIGNED_BAM

arguments.summary: The number of bases trimmed from the beginning of read 2 prior to alignment
arguments.name: --READ2_TRIM

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: The order in which the merged reads should be output.
arguments.name: --SORT_ORDER

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Detect reads originating from foreign organisms (e.g. bacterial DNA in a non-bacterial sample),and unmap + label those reads accordingly.
arguments.name: --UNMAP_CONTAMINANT_READS

arguments.summary: Original SAM or BAM file of unmapped reads, which must be in queryname order.
arguments.name: --UNMAPPED_BAM

arguments.summary: How to deal with alignment information in reads that are being unmapped (e.g. due to cross-species contamination.) Currently ignored unless UNMAP_CONTAMINANT_READS = true
arguments.name: --UNMAPPED_READ_STRATEGY

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

description:
A command-line tool to merge BAM/SAM alignment info from a third-party aligner with the data in an
 unmapped BAM file, producing a third BAM file that has alignment data and all the additional data
 from the unmapped BAM
name: MergeBamAlignment
